item.title: Fly tipping , bins overflowing, rats, 18th September
item.description:
Bins stored on pavement, they need to be removed asap. They don’t belong to a particular property and it’s encouraging people to fly tip next to the bins. Dreadful smell, rodents, public health issue

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brooke Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 18th September
item.description:
It is every week I’m having to report the same issues and it’s becoming tiresome, when are the council going to put up cameras to solve this problem it’s not hard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Strathnairn Street, Bermondsey, London

item.title: You have installed a trench across the whole road but failed to properly backfill it., 18th September
item.description:
I cycle and the drop into the brand new trench is awful. Your contractors really do need to up there game with better quality control.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Royal Parade, Chislehurst, London

item.title: 14 Algernon rd, 18th September
item.description:
A bin has appeared on the pavement. It has been there for almost 2 weeks and seems to not be allocated to anyone.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Algernon Road, London

item.title: Large hole in road, 18th September
item.description:
This hole has now been here 6+ weeks with no work being done. It has been reported before yet nothing has been done. No license and no idea who dug the hole. It juts out into the road causing delays and is dangerous . Why was the previous report closed with nothing done???

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 51, Mottingham Road, Mottingham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic bollard, at the north end of Peckham Grove and near Newent Close ., 18th September
item.description:
This bollard doesn't have a padlock. On a few occasions now I have cycled past and the bollard has been removed and discarded by the side of the road. I reported this a month or so ago and if the padlock was replaced it's now missing once again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Peckham Grove, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Misused rubbish bin- danger to drivers (2), 18th September
item.description:
This rubbish bin is daily used for domestic rubbish. Wind often takes debris and bags to the middle of the road and it is an accident waiting to happen. I have already witnessed a motorist and a cyclist falling trying to avoid the debris. The solution is to remove the bin or to apply existing legislation and fine the recurring offenders.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, West Eaton Place, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flags up without permission, 18th September
item.description:
Someone has put an England flag up on a lamppost without permission of the people who live next to it. We want it removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prescott Avenue, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass needs cutting, 18th September
item.description:
After all the rain we have had. The grass needs cutting at Grassmead Park. The main reason is that there are a number of holes that have been dug by animals, but you can't see them. This could cause some to twist or break an ankle if you stepped into to one.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stanton Close, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Next to 119 ampleforth bins, 18th September
item.description:
Am sick to death of people putting their rubbish out for the council to collect as if they live in the blocks. It looks disgusting and trampy. This needs to be sorted, as everyone is sick to death of this constantly happening. There needs to be a sign, or the bins need to have a lock so that only the people who live in the blocks can access them, because it’s honestly boring now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sewell Road, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken branch of street tree, 18th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Temple Grove, Temple Fortune, London
